author: albusdompeldorius
content:
Hi, did you get an answer to this?

I just learned about the splitting zero attack, and if my understanding is correct, this attack just proves that BLS aggregation does not have the property that the individual signatures in an aggregate signature are message-binding. In other words, some of the individual signatures (belonging to the attacker) that make up an aggregate signature of some message M, can in fact be a valid signature of a different message M'.

My guess is that the message-binding property is not necessary for the security of BLS signatures in Ethereum, but I haven't seen a confirmation of this. Can anyone confirm if this is true?
